content: Yes, the University of Virginia offers guided tours for visitors that are conducted by knowledgeable and friendly student guides. The tours provide an overview of the university's history, academic programs, research initiatives, and student life, which can help visitors better understand and appreciate the campus's unique culture and identity. Additionally, the university also offers self-guided tours that allow visitors to explore the campus at their own pace using a printed or digital map provided by the university's Visitor Center. The Visitor Center also provides information regarding the best places to park and the best ways to navigate the campus.
